snippet: Comments by Rwanda’s president show how both nations still struggle to come to terms with the massacres two decades ago.
abstract: News analysis; 20th anniversary of Rwandan genocide rekindles longstanding diplomatic tension between Rwanda and France; Rwandan Pres Paul Kagame's claims that France is partly responsible for carnage shows how both nations still struggle to come to terms with the massacre two decades ago.

byline.original: By ALISSA J. RUBIN and MAÏA de la BAUME

lead_paragraph: Comments by Rwanda’s president show how both nations still struggle to come to terms with the massacres two decades ago.

headline.main: Claims of French Complicity in Rwanda’s Genocide Rekindle Mutual Resentment
headline.print_headline: Claims of French Complicity in Rwanda’s Genocide Rekindle Mutual Resentment

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
